snippet: The Obama administration is exploring measures that it hopes will make closing the prison politically and logistically easier.
abstract: Obama administration, continuing to attempt to reduce number of detainees at Guantanamo Bay to number that would facilitate closing facility, is exploring ways to cut current population of military prison in half; details of plan are not released, but officials hope to send some prisoners overseas for prosecution in foreign courts and strike plea agreements with others on civilian charges.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is exploring measures that it hopes will make closing the prison politically and logistically easier.

headline.main: Frustrated in Efforts to Close Guantánamo Prison, Officials Look to Reduce Population
headline.print_headline: Frustrated in Efforts to Close Guantánamo, Officials Try to Split Population

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
